description:
**Fix Overview**:

To address the Windows Cryptographic Services remote code execution vulnerability (CVE-2024-20682), please ensure your affected systems are updated with the appropriate security patches:

1. Identify your system's version and match it against the provided build numbers below to determine which updates to apply.
2. Download and apply the respective updates from the Microsoft Update Catalog links provided.
3. Restart your system after installation to ensure all updates are applied correctly.

**Details**:
- This vulnerability allows remote code execution. There are several relevant KB articles that can be applied to mitigate this issue, including KB-5034134, KB-5034123, KB-5034122, and KB-5034121.
- For each Windows version, ensure you download the corresponding update package from the links below:
  - Windows 11 (x64): [KB5034123](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5034123)
  - Windows 10 (x64): [KB5034134](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5034134)
  - Windows Server 2016: [KB5034119](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5034119)
- Backup critical data before proceeding.

**Preconditions**:
- Ensure the system is running a vulnerable version of Windows.
- Confirm that you have administrative privileges to install updates.

For further details regarding this vulnerability, please refer to the publication date of January 9, 2024.
